text: fourteen-year-old Abdullah was at school
yesterday today his family's warning him
he was among more than 130 children
killed in the Army Public School
massacre a top student
Abdullah's family say he loved birds and
gardening the Racine's of grief at the
local graveyard relatives and friends
prayed for the teenage boy before he was
laid to rest would have gone like this
Abdullah's uncle shibir talked of his
nephew a bright boy he said he's more
than a son to me
more than a daughter to me more than a
brother to me more than ever because you
are the genius he could have it could
have been been an asset for Pakistan he
could have been asset for Pakistan and
he's gone Abdullah's neighbor
thirteen-year-old Hayes's was also at
the auditorium he survived the attack
his father had rushed to the school when
he heard the news I was crying at that
moment company personnel people calling
me then don't go there how it is
possible I'm earning for my kids if I
don't have my kids what is there they
were shot and there was many blood
behind them
[Music]
I was a very fun I was very scared and
Franken as the country observed three
days of mourning people here have come
out for the day expressing their sorrow
many locals have gathered outside the
school in solidarity with the families
of the children who were attacked
there's still a strong sense of shock
and disbelief and what happened but also
anger anger at the Taliban for
committing this massacre but also anger
at the government for not being able to
protect those children these pictures
released by the Pakistani Taliban show
the men they say carried out the attack
in a statement they said the only men to
attack senior students not the younger
children after visiting the wounded in
Peshawar today the country's Prime
Minister vowed to face the militants
with an iron fist
today national leadership has reiterated
this vow of solidarity and has decided
that we will continue this war as long
as there is even one terrorists
remaining on our soil there is huge
pressure on Pakistan's leadership to
take a firm stance against militancy
here throughout the day people took to
the streets in protest but there are
still many questions left unanswered
most crucially is whether this attack
will mark a turning point in the
country's fight against the Taliban
